bugs.description: ModalPortal.open() calls focusManager.setupScopedFocus(this.node), but 'this.node' is never assigned anywhere in ModalPortal. As a result 'undefined' is passed, leaving focusManager.modalElement null. When the blur/focus handlers later run, they execute modalElement.contains(...), which throws a TypeError ("Cannot read property 'contains' of null/undefined") and can crash the application when the modal is opened. The method should pass a valid DOM element, probably the overlay or content element (e.g., this.content or this.overlay), or set this.node accordingly before use.
